A library to work with serial ports using pure Nim.OS X specific code to list available serial ports using IO Kit.Common definitions shared between platform specific implementations.

Imports

termios

Types

Parity = enum
  none, odd, even
Allowable parities for the serial port.   Source Edit 
BaudRate = enum
  BR0 = 0, BR50 = 50, BR75 = 75, BR110 = 110, BR134 = 134, BR150 = 150, BR200 = 200, BR300 = 300,
  BR600 = 600, BR1200 = 1200, BR1800 = 1800, BR2400 = 2400, BR4800 = 4800, BR9600 = 9600,
  BR19200 = 19200, BR38400 = 38400
Serial baud rates.   Source Edit 
DataBits = enum
  five, six, seven, eight
The standard length of data bits per byte for the serial port.   Source Edit 
StopBits = enum
  one, onePointFive, two
The standard number of stopbits per byte for the serial port.   Source Edit

Flow control settings for use with a serial port.   Source Edit 
SerialPort = ref SerialPortObj not nil
Represents a serial port.   Source Edit 
SerialPortError = object of Exception
Base error type for errors raised by the serialport module.   Source Edit 
InvalidPortNameError = object of SerialPortError
Raised if an invalid port name is provided when opening a serial port with openSerialPort.   Source Edit 
PortClosedError = object of SerialPortError
Raised when an operation is attempted on a port that is closed.   Source Edit 
PortReadError = object of SerialPortError
Raised when an error occurs whilst reading a serial port.   Source Edit 
PortReadTimeoutError = object of SerialPortError
Raised when reading from a serial port times out.   Source Edit

Convert a port to a string, using the port's name.   Source Edit 
proc openSerialPort(name: string; baudRate: BaudRate = BaudRate.BR9600;
                   dataBits: DataBits = DataBits.eight;
                   parity: Parity = Parity.none; stopBits: StopBits = StopBits.one;
                   useHardwareFlowControl: bool = false;
                   useSoftwareFlowControl: bool = false): SerialPort {.

    raises: [InvalidPortNameError, OSError], tags: []
.}

Open the serial port with the given name.

If the serial port at the given path is not found, a InvalidPortNameError will be raised.

  Source Edit

                                        tags: WriteIOEffect

Write data to the serial port. This ensures that all of data is written.   Source Edit 
proc read(port: SerialPort; data: pointer; size: int; timeout: int = - 1): int {.

    raises: [PortClosedError, PortReadTimeoutError, OSError], tags: [ReadIOEffect]
.}

Read from the serial port into the buffer pointed to by data, with buffer length size.

This will return the number of bytes received, as it does not guarantee that the buffer will be filled completely.

The read will time out after timeout seconds if no data is received in that time. To disable timeouts, pass -1 a the timeout parameter. When timeouts are disabled, this will block until at least 1 byte of data is received.

  Source Edit
